body.name: PEIOUS Trackball Mouse Wireless - Ergonomic Rollerball Mouse with RGB Backlit,(2.4G USB + Bluetooth) Connection Thumb Control Mouse Rechargeable Compatible with iPad, Mac, Windows PC - Black

features: Trackball Mouse Under Your Thumb Control -- Featuring with a trackball movement, no more pushing the mouse around with your wrist and arms, your thumb is what makes this mouse awesome! The thumb manipulation takes a little getting used to, but once you use it for a while it becomes second-nature

Smooth&Precise Rollerball Tracking wherever -- With this rollerball mouse, you can employ quite a bit of motion in an extremely limited space, rolling the trackball with your thumb is all it takes and the mouse remains stationary on your busy desk, comfy sofas and lumpy beds etc.

2.4G Dongle+Bluetooth 3-Way Connection -- This mouse come with a 2.4G USB dongle, can also connect by Bluetooth without the dongle, which provides perfect solution if you have more than one computers on your desk. Just 1 “click” to switch from your home PC to work laptop and Tablet easily without having to switch the USB receiver each time

Ergonomic Comfort Design for Natural Grip -- The shape of mouse is comfortable, which ergonomically fits your palm perfectly. It’s a great option if you need to be on the computer frequently for long periods of time, once you start using it, you will never go back to a regular mouse or trackpad

Rechargeable Mouse with Adjustable LED Light -- Equipped with build-in rechargeable battery, so no more worries about replacing the batteries at the most inopportune time, you can recharge the mouse easily with the Type-c cable included in package. There is a RGB light strip on the top of mouse which is a fun addition to this Mouse

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Please Pay Attention Before Placing Your Orders: 1. This Mouse only works with trackball tracking, no light sensor underneath; 2. The backward and forward button is not fully compatible with Mac OS; 3. Please recharge the mouse with the Type-C cable included in package; 4. DPI button is located on the bottom of the mouse, please adjust to proper DPI level before using; 5. The mouse can be connected with 2.4G (USB dongle) + Bluetooth1/Bluetooth2 (without the dongle);

Thumb Control Rollerball Mouse The rollerball offers convenient thumb control, allowing you to fully navigate the pointer without moving the mouse. Additionally, it can be easily removed for hassle-free cleaning of the interior An Awesome Space Saver If you're frustrated with limited mouse space, give this mouse a try. It only requires movement from your right thumb and fingers for operation

Connect Up to 3 Computers Connect up to 3 devices by using 2.4G USB+Bluetooth+Bluetooth connection. The switch button is located on the bottom of the mouse A Fun Addition While Working It has a customizable LED strip on top, allowing you to adjust it according to your preference. You have the option to turn it off for energy-saving Rehcargeable Ball Mouse With a built-in rechargeable battery, it eliminates the need to replace batteries unexpectedly. Recharging is hassle-free using the included cable Smooth & Precise Tracking The smooth trackball ensures precise tracking, and the DPI setting can be adjusted with the switch button on the bottom for finer mouse movements

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's Not Dead Yet!
reviews.reviewText: I keep thinking the mouse is truly dead, then realizing that the USB-C cable I plugged it into is the 100W one I charge my power-sucking laptops and such with. It automatically shuts down charging to protect itself if you do that, so you think it should be fully charged and NOTHING happens. I've started to do the return process TWICE because of this (maybe I need a sticky note on my monitor) before realizing what I did.I bought this to replace a Logitech M570 that's been starting to have issues, and I think I might like it better. The angle of my thumb seems better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for me
reviews.reviewText: I have gotten so used to Microsoft Ergo keyboards in the last 20-30 years that I have to have the split to be able to type effectively, but they are expensive and I typically keep at least one new in box for when they crap out. I have a 65" Sony TV in the bedroom, and it seems no sooner than I get in bed I need something else that neither my cell phone or Kindle will handle. So, I added a Geekom Mini Air 11 for $129, which is perfect. But now to make it very user friendly I needed a full sized ergo keyboard, USB wireless, and backlit. Got that. To complete the picture I needed a USB wireless trackball. I have several Logitechs and others and this one was dedicated to bedroom. Left ball, top buttons, scroll wheel. I noticed this one for a few dollars extra with a disply light and rationalized how handy it would be to find among the covers and two Chihuahuas. This one is it. I love it. Feels just like my Logitech, charges from a S cord (of which I have several, right by the bed, for Kindles, flashlights, bluetooth headphones). This is just what the doctor ordered! Great price. Total no brainer!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great mouse but no warning when battery dies
reviews.reviewText: This mouse if comfortable to use and works great. The one downside is when it needs recharging, it just stops working. Suggest if this is for heavy daily use like long days working/gaming, either charge nightly or at least every couple days

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Terrific feel and very comfortable
reviews.reviewText: I'm an avid trackball user as I spend many hours on my computer for work and this eliminates any wrist discomfort. If you are a new to trackballs, it takes a couple days to get used to the thumb movement but ABSOLUTELY worth it. As for this particular mouse, great buy! I found it on Prime Day and needed another to replace my 5 year old previous version. This is the first I've owned that is rechargeable meaning previous models were powered by a aaa battery where this comes with a USB cord for charging. So far, I've owned the mouse for a week with non-stop daily use and have yet to recharge it (after an initial charge out of the box). The nice thing is the cord is long and can easily be used while charging. The ball is smooth and responsive as expected and I was pleasantly surprised by the feel of the 'click' for the buttons. Rather than your typical loud click, this has a softer feel with virtually no sound. The haptic feedback is more than enough to know you pressed it but it's nice being so quiet. Lastly, the color on the edge is a nice touch and customizable. I would absolutely recommend this mouse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love the lights! And it is ergonomic!
reviews.reviewText: I like most everything about is. The ball rolls smoothly and it is easy to clean. The lights are customizable and pleasant. I just wish I could figure out how to make it flash at me when the battery is dying. Other than that, I would purchase it again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not working properly after 4 months
reviews.reviewText: I really liked it until it started acting funky after only 4 months of use. I don't know how to explain it... The ball would spin but the cursor wouldn't move far. I took the ball out and cleaned it and charged it overnight but nothing has helped. I increased the speed of the mouse on my computer settings as far as it would go and that helped a little bit but I still have to spin the ball a lot to get the cursor where it needs to go. It just started doing that yesterday so it's gotta be a defect with the mouse. I had to "same day" order a different mouse today so I can effectively work. Super disappointed that this mouse lasted 4 months. I wouldn't recommend this mouse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I've used Logitech mice for years, but the last models seemed off and hard to use. They acted like they hadn't been cleaned in forever, even though I cleaned them out constantly. So, I decided to try this brand, and it's been great! Battery life is good, but you can plug it in and keep using it even when it runs out. I'm going to buy another one for my work computer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really great trackball for the price
reviews.reviewText: I bought this trackball and a name-brand Elecom EX-G trackball at the same time for comparison's sake as they are almost the same price ($30 for the Elecom and $36 for this) and I've had good luck with other Elecom trackballs. I can say that both perform very well and are quite similar in layout and function, though I do enjoy the LED lighting on this trackball. They both use identical (interchangeable) balls, have the same number of buttons, have forward/back buttons and a DPI selector. --It's clear the Elecom was the basis for this trackball's design. Probably the biggest advantage this trackball has over the Elecom is the wide selection of connnections; the Elecom only has 2.4 GHz wireless (With a USB dongle) connectivity, while this trackball has two different Bluetooth connections and the wireless dongle to choose from, plus it has a built-in rechargeable cell while the Elecom uses a single AA. Some people may prefer the AA since it future-proofs the Elecom against the eventual failure of the built-in rechargeable cell, however for this price it's not really a big deal.To sum up, they both seem to perform quite well for a very reasonable price-- having Bluetooth connection options is a pretty big advantage, and that's the main thing that really made me prefer this trackball over the Elecom EX-G. One thing I really would have appreciated is the ability to use either of them as wired trackballs too, so it's unfortunate that this trackball didn't take advantage of its USB-C connection used for charging to also allow wired operation.
